com.here.android.mpa.ar

Class ARController.CameraParams

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.ar.ARController.CameraParams
  • Enclosing class:
    ARController

    public static final class ARController.CameraParams
extends java.lang.Object
    Encapsulates parameters which affect the device camera. The device camera is used when in ARController.ViewType.CAMERA view.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • setSize

        public ARController.CameraParams setSize(Size size)
        Set camera resolution for Camera view. Currently, any size equal to or greater than 640X480 is supported. This call should be made prior to creating AndroidXCompositeFragment object.

        When a custom size is set, it will be matched to the closest supported size for a given device, as reported by ARController.CameraParams.getPreviewSizes().

        Setting the camera size to high resolutions has a significant performance impact.

        Parameters:
        size - Camera resolution. See Size
        Returns:
        CameraParams object.

      • getSize

        public Size getSize()
        Get camera resolution for Camera view.
        Returns:
        size Camera resolution. See Size

      • setFps

        public ARController.CameraParams setFps(int fps)
        Set camera FPS. This call should be made prior to creating AndroidXCompositeFragment object.
        Parameters:
        fps - Camera FPS.
        Returns:
        CameraParams object.

      • getFps

        public int getFps()
        Get camera FPS.
        Returns:
        Camera FPS. If not available -1.

      • getHorizontalFov

        public float getHorizontalFov()
        Get horizontal field of view of Camera view in the AndroidXCompositeFragment. This is not camera hardware filed of view. IMPORTANT! View has to exist in the AndroidXCompositeFragment in order to retrieve the value, otherwise invalid value is returned.
        Returns:
        horizontal field of view, in degrees

      • getVerticalFov

        public float getVerticalFov()
        Get vertical field of view of Camera view in the AndroidXCompositeFragment. This is not camera hardware filed of view. IMPORTANT! View has to exist in the AndroidXCompositeFragment in order to retrieve the value, otherwise invalid value is returned.
        Returns:
        vertical field of view, in degrees

      • getPreviewSizes

        public Size[] getPreviewSizes()
        Get the array of supported camera resolutions for Camera view.
        Returns:
        The array of supported camera resolutions. null if camera not found. See Size
